title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page displays life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for a chosen country.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.rcParams["figure.dpi"] = 120

# Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Choose the country to analyze (change here if needed)
country = "China"
country_data = gapminder[gapminder['country'] == country]

# Plot 1: Life Expectancy
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['life_expectancy'], color="#6A0DAD")
plt.title(f"Life Expectancy Over Time in {country}")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.grid(True)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Plot 2: GDP per Capita (log scale)
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['gdp_per_capita'], color="#87CEFA")
plt.yscale("log")
plt.title(f"GDP per Capita (log scale) in {country}")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita (log scale)")
plt.grid(True)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Plot 3: Population
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['population_millions'], color="#FF6B6B")
plt.title(f"Population (millions) Over Time in {country}")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Population (millions)")
plt.grid(True)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
